metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20296 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.0-beta. A crafted input file supplied by an attacker, that is processed by the Dwa decompression functionality of OpenEXR's IlmImf library, could cause a NULL pointer dereference. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr-3-1-30 - 2.5.7-1
openexr - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
